ppe_requirements.respiratory: NIOSH-approved air-purifying respirator with P100 particulate filters for ≤50 mg/m³. PAPR for higher concentrations. SCBA for unknown or emergency response.
ppe_requirements.skin: Leather or cotton gloves adequate for dust. Welding gloves for metal work.
ppe_requirements.eye: Safety glasses with side shields. Welding goggles/helmet for welding operations.
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level D for dust <10 mg/m³, Level C for >10 mg/m³ or welding fume
ppe_requirements.special_notes: Metal fume fever primary concern. Prevent inhalation during welding/cutting galvanized metal. Symptoms develop 4-12 hours post-exposure. Well-ventilated work areas essential.

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Non-combustible. May release toxic zinc oxide fume when heated above 1000°C.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Use agent appropriate for surrounding fire. Wear SCBA - toxic fumes possible.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Avoid generating dust. Sweep or vacuum with HEPA filter. Place in sealed containers. Dispose as non-hazardous or hazardous depending on concentration and source.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove from exposure. If metal fume fever suspected: rest, fluids, symptomatic treatment. Symptoms self-limiting 24-48 hours. If severe: seek medical attention. Monitor respiratory function.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Toxic to aquatic life. May contaminate soil/water. Generally low environmental risk.
emergency_response.special_hazards: METAL FUME FEVER: flu-like symptoms 4-12 hours post-exposure (fever, chills, nausea, muscle aches). Self-limiting but recurrent with repeated exposure. Welding galvanized metal major exposure source.

storage_requirements.ventilation: General ventilation adequate. Keep containers closed.
storage_requirements.container_material: Plastic or metal containers with tight lids.
storage_requirements.segregation: None required for pure zinc oxide. Separate from incompatibles.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: None specified. Follow facility storage protocols.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Keep containers closed when not in use. Store in dry area. Prevent dust accumulation.

regulatory_classification.un_number: None (not regulated as hazardous for transport)

biological_exposure_indices.timing: End of shift, end of work week

hazardous_decomposition: Zinc vapors at very high temperatures
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: Generally stable. Reacts with strong acids producing hydrogen gas. May ignite spontaneously with linseed oil.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Very toxic to aquatic life. LC50 (fish, 96h): 0.5-5 mg/L depending on pH and hardness. More toxic in soft acidic water.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: Moderate bioaccumulation. BCF: 10-100. Essential element but toxic at high levels.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: Low mobility. Adsorbs to soil particles. Persistence: indefinite.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Settles as particulate. Does not react in atmosphere.

reportable_releases.water: 1000 lbs zinc compounds to navigable waters
